info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 4 at 7:30AM EDT until April 8 at 8:46PM EDT by NWS Louisville KY
info.description:
...The National Weather Service in Louisville KY has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Kentucky...
Kentucky River at High Bridge Lock affecting Mercer, Garrard and Jessamine Counties.
Kentucky River at Frankfort Lock affecting Woodford, Anderson and Franklin Counties.
.Heavy rain from the past few days has caused the river to rise.
* WHAT...Major flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Kentucky River at Frankfort Lock.
* WHEN...From this afternoon to Tuesday evening.
* IMPACTS...At 38.0 feet, KY 420 (Old Lawrenceburg Road) closes. Wilkerson Street, Watson Court, Wilson Street, and Kentucky Avenue flood. Many basements of homes flood. At 39.0 feet, Portions of Logan Street, Norton Street and Murray Street flood. Riverboat Landing is flooded. At 40.0 feet, Paul Sawyer Drive, East Second Street, East Fourth Street and Admirals Landing flood. The entrance at McDonald Ferry Road floods. The campground at Steele Branch Road is closed. Warehouses along Great Buffalo Trace Rd. flood.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:30 AM EDT Friday the stage was 24.7 feet. - Bankfull stage is 28.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this afternoon to a crest of 40.0 feet Sunday evening. It will then fall below flood stage early Tuesday afternoon. - Flood stage is 31.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 40.2 feet on 03/05/2021. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/lmk.
The next statement will be issued by Saturday afternoon at 200 PM EDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON TO TUESDAY EVENING

area.areaDesc: Anderson, KY; Franklin, KY; Woodford, KY
